attributes.description: Principal Investigator(s) leading the study where the data is/was used.
attributes.name: study_pi
attributes.title: study_pi

attributes.description: *Note: Name of the covariate that confers the dominant batch effect in the data as judged by the data contributor. The name provided here should be the label by which this covariate is stored in the AnnData object.*
attributes.name: batch_condition
attributes.title: batch_condition
attributes.values: Values must refer to cell metadata keys in obs. Together, these keys define the batches that a normalisation or integration algorithm should be aware of. For example if "patient" and "seqBatch" are keys of vectors of cell metadata, either ["patient"], ["seqBatch"], or ["patient", "seqBatch"] are valid values.

attributes.description: The value must match a key to an embedding in obsm for the embedding to display by default in CELLxGENE Explorer.
attributes.name: default_embedding
attributes.title: default_embedding

attributes.description: Platform used for sequencing.
attributes.name: sequencing_platform
attributes.rationale: This captures potential strand hopping which may cause data quality issues.
attributes.title: sequencing_platform

attributes.description: Platform used for single cell library construction.
attributes.name: assay_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: Major source of batch effect and dataset filtering criterion
attributes.title: assay_ontology_term_id
attributes.values:
This must be an EFO term and either:
"EFO:0002772" for assay by molecule or preferably its most accurate child
"EFO:0010183" for single cell library construction or preferably its most accurate child
An assay based on 10X Genomics products should either be "EFO:0008995" for 10x technology or preferably its most accurate child. An assay based on SMART (Switching Mechanism at the 5' end of the RNA Template) or SMARTer technology SHOULD either be "EFO:0010184" for Smart-like or preferably its most accurate child.

Recommended:
10x 3' v2 "EFO:0009899"
10x 3' v3 "EFO:0009922"
10x 5' v1 "EFO:0011025"
10x 5' v2 "EFO:0009900"
Smart-seq2 "EFO:0008931"
Visium Spatial Gene Expression "EFO:0010961"

attributes.description: Reference genome used for alignment.
attributes.name: reference_genome
attributes.rationale: Possible source of batch effect and confounder for some biological analysis
attributes.title: reference_genome
attributes.values: GRCh38; GRCh37; GRCm39; GRCm38; GRCm37; not applicable

attributes.description: Protocol used for alignment analysis, please specify which version was used e.g. cell ranger 2.0, 2.1.1 etc.
attributes.name: alignment_software
attributes.rationale: Affects which cells are filtered per dataset, and which reads (introns and exons or only exons) are counted as part of the reported transcriptome. This can convey batch effects.
attributes.title: alignment_software

attributes.description: Were introns included during read counting in the alignment process?
attributes.name: intron_inclusion
attributes.rationale: yes
attributes.title: intron_inclusion

attributes.description: Which part of the RNA transcript was targeted for sequencing.
attributes.name: sequenced_fragment
attributes.rationale: May be a source of batch effect that has to be tested.
attributes.title: sequenced_fragment
attributes.values: 3 prime tag; 5 prime tag; probe-based; full length

attributes.description:
Ensembl release version accession number. Some common codes include:
GRCh38.p12 = GCF_000001405.38
GRCh38.p13 = GCF_000001405.39
GRCh38.p14 = GCF_000001405.40
attributes.name: gene_annotation_version
attributes.rationale: Possible source of batch effect and confounder for some biological analysis
attributes.title: gene_annotation_version

attributes.description: Other technical or experimental covariates that could affect the quality or batch of the sample. Must not contain identifiers. This field is designed to capture potential challenges for data integration not captured elsewhere.
attributes.name: comments
attributes.title: comments

attributes.description: The protocols.io URL (if none exists, please use the BioRxiv URL) for the full experimental protocol; or if multiple protocols exist please list them e.g. sample preparation protocol / sequencing protocol.
attributes.name: protocol_url
attributes.rationale: Useful to look up protocol data that can provide insight on batch effects. As protocols can sometimes apply to a subset of the study, we capture this at a sample level. This information may not always be available.
attributes.title: protocol_url

attributes.description: This text describes and differentiates the dataset from other datasets in the same collection. It is strongly recommended that each dataset title in a collection is unique and does not depend on other metadata such as a different assay to disambiguate it from other datasets in the collection.
attributes.example: Cells of the adult human heart collection is "All — Cells of the adult human heart"
attributes.name: title
attributes.rationale: Useful to look up protocol data that can provide insight on batch effects. As protocols can sometimes apply to a subset of the study, we capture this at a sample level. This information may not always be available.
attributes.title: title

attributes.description: This must be free-text that identifies a unique individual that data were derived from.
attributes.name: donor_id
attributes.rationale: Fundamental unit of biological variation of the data.
attributes.title: donor_id
attributes.values: It is strongly recommended that this identifier be designed so that it is unique to: a given individual within the collection of datasets that includes this dataset, and a given individual across all collections in CELLxGENE Discover. It is strongly recommended that "pooled" be used for observations from a sample of multiple individuals that were not confidently assigned to a single individual through demultiplexing. It is strongly recommended that "unknown" ONLY be used for observations in a dataset when it is not known which observations are from the same individual.

attributes.description: The name given to the type of organism, collected in NCBITaxon:0000 format.
attributes.name: organism_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: Strong biological effect that needs to be considered for batch covariate selection.
attributes.title: organism_ontology_term_id
attributes.values: "NCBITaxon:9606" for Homo sapiens or "NCBITaxon:10090" for Mus musculus.

attributes.description:
Manner of death classification based on the Hardy Scale or 'unknown' or 'not applicable':
* Category 1 = Violent and fast death Deaths due to accident, blunt force trauma or suicide, terminal phase estimated at < 10 min.
* Category 2 = Fast death of natural causes -Sudden unexpected deaths of people who had been reasonably healthy, after a terminal phase estimated at < 1 hr (with sudden death from a myocardial infarction as a model cause of death for this category)
* Category 3 = Intermediate death - Death after a terminal phase of 1 to 24 hrs (not classifiable as 2 or 4); patients who were ill but death was unexpected
* Category 4 = Slow death - Death after a long illness, with a terminal phase longer than 1 day (commonly cancer or chronic pulmonary disease); deaths that are not unexpected
* Category 0 =Ventilator Case - All cases on a ventilator immediately before death
* Unknown = The cause of death is unknown
* Not applicable = Subject is alive
[Please leave this field as blank for embryonic/fetal tissue]
attributes.name: manner_of_death
attributes.rationale: Manner of death can affect cellular profiles.
attributes.title: manner_of_death

attributes.description: Reported sex of the donor.
attributes.example: PATO:0000383 for female, PATO:0000384 for male
attributes.name: sex_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: Likely biological effect. Need to know if we have a balanced dataset or if sex is collinear with the dataset.
attributes.title: sex_ontology_term_id
attributes.values: This must be a child of PATO:0001894 for phenotypic sex or "unknown" if unavailable.

attributes.description: Self reported ethnicity of the subject.
attributes.name: self_reported_ethnicity_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: CELLxGENE core schema
attributes.title: self_reported_ethnicity_ontology_term_id
attributes.values: If organism_ontolology_term_id is "NCBITaxon:9606" for Homo sapiens, this must be a HANCESTRO term or "unknown". Otherwise, for all organisms, this must be "na". Requirements for data contributors adhering to GDPR or like standards: HCA will be collecting ethnicity data as part of HCA's Tier 2 metadata that is protected by managed access, therefore please put 'unknown' for this field.

attributes.description: Age of donor at the time of sample collection. Specify the age unit (week, month, year) in age_unit.
attributes.name: age_value
attributes.rationale: Age can impact cellular and molecular phenotypes.
attributes.title: age_value

attributes.description: Age unit (week, month, year) for the age_value.
attributes.name: age_unit
attributes.rationale: Age can impact cellular and molecular phenotypes.
attributes.title: age_unit

attributes.description: Body mass index of the donor at the time of collection.
attributes.name: bmi
attributes.rationale: May serve as a covariate for analysis of human diversity. If height or weight is not provided but BMI is, fill here.
attributes.title: bmi

attributes.description: Height of donor in cm at the time of collection.
attributes.name: height
attributes.rationale: Highly heritable (PMID: 36224396); together with weight can allow for computation of body-mass index, which may serve as a covariate for analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: height

attributes.description: Weight of donor in kilograms at the time of collection.
attributes.name: weight
attributes.rationale: Together with height can allow for computation of body-mass index, which may serve as a covariate for analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: weight

attributes.description: Donor self-reported gender identity.
attributes.example: Female Gender; Male Gender; Non-Binary Gender; Other Gender; Agender; Gender Fluid; Gender Identifier X; Genderqueer; Transgender; Two-spirit
attributes.name: genderidentity_selfreported
attributes.rationale: Gender identity information may be important for studies involving hormonal treatments, etc.
attributes.title: genderidentity_selfreported

attributes.description: Donor self-reported ethnicity (or ethnicities) in free-text; can include tribe, dialect group, etc. If race information is submitted under this field, please ensure that the question(s) and response options posed to donors are included in the next metadata category ("ethnicity_question_text"). Separate multiple entries with a comma.
attributes.name: ethnicity_selfreported_freetext
attributes.rationale: Self-reported ethnicity information can encompass language, religion, tribe, and cultural factors, beyond genetic ancestry.
attributes.title: ethnicity_selfreported_freetext

attributes.description: Question and response options posed to donors for collecting metadata on donor self-reported ethnicity and / or tribe and / or dialect group and / or race etc.
attributes.example: "What is your ethnicity?"; "Are you Hispanic/Latino?"; Example from All of Us "Which categories describe you? Select all that apply. Note You may select more than one group. American Indian or Alaska Native (for example, Aztec, Blackfeet Tribe, Mayan, Navajo Nation, Native Village of Barrow (Utqiagvik) Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, etc.)* Asian (for example, Asian Indian, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, etc.)* Black, African American, or African (for example, African American, Ethiopian, Haitian, Jamaican, Nigerian, Somali, etc.)* Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish (for example, Columbian, Cuban, Dominican, Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Salvadoran, etc.)* Middle Eastern or North African (for example, Algerian, Egyptian, Iranian, Lebanese, Moroccan, Syrian, etc.)* Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander (for example, Chamorro, Fijian, Marshallese, Native Hawaiian, Tongan, etc.)* White (for example, English, European, French, German, Irish, Italian, Polish, etc.)* None of these fully describe me (optional free text answer) Prefer not to answer" not collected, not available
attributes.name: ethnicity_question_text
attributes.rationale: Provides context on the method for collecting self-reported ethnicity, tribe, dialect group, or race information. Self-reported ethnicity information can encompass language, religion, tribe, and cultural factors, beyond genetic ancestry.
attributes.title: ethnicity_question_text

attributes.description: Primary language(s), spoken by donor. Can include dialects (for example, Hokkien).
attributes.example: Mandarin Chinese; Hokkien; Bahasa Melayu; Tamil; Hausa; Yoruba; Swahili
attributes.name: language_donor_primary_language
attributes.rationale: Primary language(s) may contain information relevant to ancestry, as well as a donor's environmental and cultural context.
attributes.title: language_donor_primary_language

attributes.description: Country and state of donor's current residence at time of sample collection.
attributes.example: Singapore; United Kingdom; Massachusetts USA; New South Wales Australia; Bauchi State; Nigeria
attributes.name: geography_currentresidence_location_country_state
attributes.rationale: Geographical diversity of donors, at a coarser level (country and state).
attributes.title: geography_currentresidence_location_country_state

attributes.description: Nearest city, town, or village to location of donor's current residence at time of sample collection.
attributes.name: geography_currentresidence_location_granular
attributes.rationale: Geographical diversity of donors, at a more granular level (city / town / village).
attributes.title: geography_currentresidence_location_granular

attributes.description: Specify the occupation of the donor.
attributes.example: Should be mapped to OccO Occupation Ontology OCCO:00000001
attributes.name: occupation
attributes.title: occupation

attributes.description: Indicate all comorbidities/ secondary diagnoses of the donor (primary diagnosis was asked in disease_ontology_term_id field of tier 1 metadata). This must be a MONDO term. Separate multiple entries with a comma.
attributes.name: comorbidities
attributes.title: comorbidities

attributes.description: Genotype of the biomaterial.
attributes.name: genotype
attributes.title: genotype

attributes.description: List of prescription medication consumed by the donor at time of sample collection. Should be an NCIT ontology term
attributes.name: medication
attributes.rationale: Medication consumption may be a covariate / exclusion criterion in analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: medication

attributes.description: Dietary patterns of donor – meat (chicken, seafood, fish, pork, lamb, beef, etc.) consumption versus meat-free diet – at time of sample collection. Fill yes if donor consumes meat or no if donor does not consumes meat.
attributes.rationale: Diet can impact cellular and molecular phenotypes.
attributes.title: diet_meat_consumption

attributes.description: Results from medical tests performed on the individual.
attributes.example: lipid panel shows normal level of LDL (124 mg/dL); HIV, HBV, HCV: Negative
attributes.name: medical_test_results
attributes.title: medical_test_results

attributes.description: Treatments the individual has undergone prior to biomaterial collection.
attributes.example: Patient treated with antibiotics for a urinary tract infection; Patient treated with chemotherapy (Epirubicin, cisplatin, capecitabine) to treat stomach cancer
attributes.name: treatments
attributes.title: treatments

attributes.description: Specify the type of previous surgery the individual has undergone prior to biomaterial collection.
attributes.name: previous_surgery
attributes.title: previous_surgery

attributes.description: Indicate the time interval between the surgery and the sample collection in Previous surgery Relative Time Unit
attributes.name: previous_surgery_relative_time_point
attributes.title: previous_surgery_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Indicate the Time units of the time interval between the surgery and the sample collection.
attributes.name: previous_surgery_relative_time_unit
attributes.title: previous_surgery_relative_time_unit

attributes.description: Specify the type of injury the individual underwent in the area of the collected biomaterial.
attributes.example: ankle injury; burn; spinal cord injury
attributes.name: history_of_injury_type
attributes.title: history_of_injury_type

attributes.description: Indicate the time interval between the injury and the sample collection in History of injury relative time unit.
attributes.name: history_of_injury_type_relative_time_point
attributes.title: history_of_injury_type_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Indicate the Time units of the time interval between the injury and the sample collection.
attributes.name: history_of_injury_type_relative_time_unit
attributes.title: history_of_injury_type_relative_time_unit

attributes.description: Does the donor have drink/ drank/ never drank alcohol?
attributes.name: alcohol_status
attributes.title: alcohol_status

attributes.description: Types of alcoholic beverages consumed.
attributes.name: alcohol_type
attributes.title: alcohol_type

attributes.description: Frequency of alcohol intake per week.
attributes.name: alcohol_usage_duration
attributes.title: alcohol_usage_duration

attributes.description: Alcohol consumption of donor in alcohol units per week (strength (ABV) x volume (ml) ÷ 1,000).
attributes.name: alcohol_units
attributes.title: alcohol_units

attributes.description: If the donor smokes/smoked or not.
attributes.name: smoking_status
attributes.rationale: Smoking may impact cellular and molecular phenotypes, and can serve as a covariate for human diversity analyses.
attributes.title: smoking_status

attributes.description: If smoking status is "former", specify the number of years since smoking cessation, if available.
attributes.name: years_since_smoking_cessation
attributes.title: years_since_smoking_cessation

attributes.description: Estimated number of packs (20 cigarettes) smoked per day multiplied by the number of years subject was smoking.
attributes.name: smoking_pack_years
attributes.title: smoking_pack_years

attributes.description: Nutritional state of individual at time of biomaterial collection.
attributes.name: nutritional_state
attributes.title: nutritional_state

attributes.description: Indicate the habitual level of physical activity and regular physical activities
attributes.name: physical_activity_physical_exposure
attributes.title: physical_activity_physical_exposure

attributes.description: Dominant hand of the donor
attributes.name: handedness
attributes.title: handedness

attributes.description: Where in relation to other anatomical landmarks was the tissue collected from?
attributes.name: microanatomical_region
attributes.title: microanatomical_region

attributes.description: Latitude and longitude GPS coordinates of collection site in decimal degrees.
attributes.name: geography_collectionsite_latitude_longitude
attributes.rationale: Contains information relevant for geographical diversity of donors; possible proxy for environmental exposures.
attributes.title: geography_collectionsite_latitude_longitude

attributes.description: Duration of residence, in years, rounded up to the nearest whole number, at time of sample collection.
attributes.name: geography_currentresidence_duration
attributes.rationale: Indication of duration of environmental exposure relating to current residence.
attributes.title: geography_currentresidence_duration

attributes.description: Urban, suburban, or rural descriptor of current residence.
attributes.name: geography_currentresidence_urbanrural
attributes.rationale: Contains information on environmental exposure relating to current residence
attributes.title: geography_currentresidence_urbanrural

attributes.description: Country and state of place of birth.
attributes.example: Singapore; United Kingdom; Massachusetts USA; New South Wales Australia; Bauchi State; Nigeria
attributes.name: geography_placeofbirth_location_country_state
attributes.rationale: Geographical diversity of donors, at a coarser level (country and state).
attributes.title: geography_placeofbirth_location_country_state

attributes.description: Nearest city, town, or village to location of place of birth.
attributes.name: geography_placeofbirth_location_granular
attributes.rationale: Geographical diversity of donors, at a more granular level (city / town / village).
attributes.title: geography_placeofbirth_location_granular

attributes.description: Duration of residence, in years, rounded up to the nearest whole number.
attributes.name: geography_placeofbirth_duration
attributes.rationale: Indication of duration of environmental exposure relating to place of birth.
attributes.title: geography_placeofbirth_duration

attributes.description: Urban, suburban, or rural descriptor of place of birth.
attributes.name: geography_placeofbirth_urbanrural
attributes.rationale: Contains information on environmental exposure relating to place of birth
attributes.title: geography_placeofbirth_urbanrural

attributes.description: Donor's parents' self-reported ethnicity (or ethnicities) in free-text; can include tribe, dialect group, etc. Separate multiple entries with a comma.
attributes.example: Singaporean Chinese; Singaporean Malay; Singaporean Indian; Haitian; Nigerian Hausa; Ghana Hausa; Benin Kanuri; Nigerian Kanuri; Igbo; Luo; Herero; Garifuna; Kalinago
attributes.name: ethnicity_parents_selfreported_freetext
attributes.rationale: Self-reported ethnicity information can encompass language, religion, tribe, and cultural factors, beyond genetic ancestry.
attributes.title: ethnicity_parents_selfreported_freetext

attributes.description: Ancestral language(s), spoken by parents ("mother tongue" and / or "father tongue") and / or grandparents. Can include dialects (for example, Hokkien).
attributes.example: Mandarin Chinese; Hokkien; Bahasa Melayu; Tamil; Hausa; Yoruba; Swahili
attributes.name: language_mother_father_tongue
attributes.rationale: Mother and father tongues may contain information relevant to ancestry.
attributes.title: language_mother_father_tongue

attributes.description: Age at menarche, rounded to nearest whole number.
attributes.name: menarche_age
attributes.rationale: Age at menarche may be a covariate in analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: menarche_age

attributes.description: Menopausal status of donor at time of sample collection.
attributes.example: pre-menopausal; peri-menopausal; post-menopausal; post-menopausal (induced); not applicable
attributes.name: reproductive_menopause
attributes.rationale: Menopausal status may be a covariate in analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: reproductive_menopause
attributes.values: pre-menopausal; peri-menopausal; post-menopausal; post-menopausal (induced); not applicable

attributes.description: Number of children (full-term pregnancies) the donor has given birth to at time of sample collection.
attributes.name: reproductive_number_children
attributes.rationale: Number of children (full-term pregnancies) may be a covariate in analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: reproductive_number_children

attributes.description: Number of pregnancies the donor has had at time of sample collection.
attributes.name: reproductive_number_pregnancies
attributes.rationale: Number of pregnancies may be a covariate in analyses of human diversity.
attributes.title: reproductive_number_pregnancies

attributes.description: Identification number of the sample. This is the fundamental unit of sampling the tissue (the specimen taken from the subject), which can be the same as the 'subject_ID', but is often different if multiple samples are taken from the same subject. Note: this is NOT a unit of multiplexing of donor samples, which should be stored in "library".
attributes.name: sample_id
attributes.rationale: Fundamental unit of sampling of the tissue.
attributes.title: sample_id

attributes.description: The detailed anatomical location of the sample, please provide a specific UBERON term.
attributes.name: tissue_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: Major biological effect that needs to be assessed for sufficient coverage in the atlas datasets.
attributes.title: tissue_ontology_term_id
attributes.values: If tissue_type is "tissue" or "organoid", this must be the most accurate child of UBERON:0001062 for anatomical entity. If tissue_type is "cell culture" this must follow the requirements for cell_type_ontology_term_id.

attributes.description: The detailed anatomical location of the sample - this does not have to tie to an ontology term.
attributes.name: tissue_free_text
attributes.rationale: To help the integration team understand the anatomical location of the sample, specifically to solve the problem when the UBERON ontology terms are insufficiently precise.
attributes.title: tissue_free_text

attributes.description: The study subgroup that the participant belongs to. This indicates whether the participant was a surgical donor (this includes patients providing blood samples or biopsies), a postmortem donor, or an organ donor.
attributes.name: sample_source
attributes.rationale: The source of the sample (whether the sample comes from alive subject; an organ donor; or deceased subject) can result in different cellular profiles and hence batch effects.
attributes.title: sample_source
attributes.values: surgical donor, postmortem donor, living organ donor

attributes.description: The method the sample was physically obtained from the donor.
attributes.name: sample_collection_method
attributes.rationale: Main contributor to batch effects
attributes.title: sample_collection_method
attributes.values: brush; scraping; biopsy; surgical resection; blood draw; body fluid; other

attributes.description: Whether the tissue is "tissue", "organoid", or "cell culture".
attributes.name: tissue_type
attributes.rationale: Source of batch effect & dataset exclusion criteria
attributes.title: tissue_type

attributes.description: Whether the site is considered healthy, diseased or adjacent to disease.
attributes.name: sampled_site_condition
attributes.rationale: Main contributor to batch effects
attributes.title: sampled_site_condition

attributes.description: Disease, if expected to impact the sample.
attributes.name: disease_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: CELLxGENE core schema
attributes.title: disease_ontology_term_id
attributes.values:
This must be a MONDO term or "PATO:0000461" for normal or healthy.

Requirements for data contributors adhering to GDPR or like standards: In the case of disease, HCA requests that you submit a higher order ontology term - this is especially important in the case of rare disease.

attributes.description: Indicating if tissue was frozen, or not, at any point before library preparation.
attributes.name: sample_preservation_method
attributes.rationale: Main contributor to batch effects
attributes.title: sample_preservation_method
attributes.values: ambient temperature; cut slide; fresh; frozen at -70C; frozen at -80C; frozen at -150C; frozen in liquid nitrogen; frozen in vapor phase; paraffin block; RNAlater at 4C; RNAlater at 25C; RNAlater at -20C; other

attributes.description: Specifies whether the sample contains single cells or single nuclei data.
attributes.name: suspension_type
attributes.rationale: Major source of batch effect & dataset exclusion criteria
attributes.title: suspension_type
attributes.values:
This must be "cell", "nucleus", or "na".
This must be the correct type for the corresponding assay:
* 10x transcription profiling [EFO:0030080] and its children = "cell" or "nucleus"
* ATAC-seq [EFO:0007045] and its children = "nucleus"
* BD Rhapsody Whole Transcriptome Analysis [EFO:0700003] = "cell"
* BD Rhapsody Targeted mRNA [EFO:0700004] = "cell"
* CEL-seq2 [EFO:0010010] = "cell" or "nucleus"
* CITE-seq [EFO:0009294] and its children = "cell"
* DroNc-seq [EFO:0008720] = "nucleus"
* Drop-seq [EFO:0008722] = "cell" or "nucleus"
* GEXSCOPE technology [EFO:0700011] = "cell" or "nucleus"
* inDrop [EFO:0008780] = "cell" or "nucleus"

attributes.description: This must be True if this is the canonical instance of this cellular observation and False if not. This is commonly False for meta-analyses reusing data or for secondary views of data.
attributes.name: is_primary_data
attributes.rationale: This helps to ensure samples are not used twice.
attributes.title: is_primary_data

attributes.description: Age of the subject.
attributes.name: development_stage_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: CELLxGENE core schema
attributes.title: development_stage_ontology_term_id
attributes.values:
If organism_ontolology_term_id is "NCBITaxon:9606" for Homo sapiens, this should be an HsapDv term. If organism_ontolology_term_id is "NCBITaxon:10090" for Mus musculus, this should be an HsapDv term.

Requirements for data contributors adhering to GDPR or like standards: HCA requests that you do not submit year-specific terms. For convenience, below are some broader age bracket ontology terms:
* Embryonic stage = A term from the set of Carnegie stages 1-23 = (up to 8 weeks after conception; e.g. HsapDv:0000003)
* Fetal development = A term from the set of 9 to 38 week post-fertilization human stages = (9 weeks after conception and before birth; e.g. HsapDv:0000046)
* Post natal =
  * Years 0-14 HsapDv:0000264
  * Years 15-19 HsapDv:0000268
  * Years 20-29 HsapDv:0000237
  * Years 30-39 HsapDv:0000238
  * Years 40-49 HsapDv:0000239
  * Years 50-59 HsapDv:0000240
  * Years 60-69 HsapDv:0000241
  * Years 70-79 HsapDv:0000242
Years 80-89 HsapDv:0000243

attributes.description: Specifies the cell types targeted for enrichment or depletion beyond the selection of live cells.
attributes.name: cell_enrichment
attributes.rationale: If cell lineages were filtered, this may be a dataset exclusion criterion
attributes.title: cell_enrichment
attributes.values: This must be a Cell Ontology (CL) term (http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/cl). For cells that are enriched, list the CL code followed by a "+". For cells that were depleted, list the CL code followed by a "-". If no enrichment or depletion occurred, please use 'na' (not applicable)

attributes.description: Year of sample collection. Should not be detailed further(to exact month and day), to prevent identifiability.
attributes.name: sample_collection_year
attributes.rationale: May explain whether a dataset was separated into smaller batches.
attributes.title: sample_collection_year

attributes.description: The unique ID that is used to track libraries in the investigator's institution (should align with the publication).
attributes.name: library_id
attributes.rationale: A way to track the unit of data generation. This should include sample pooling
attributes.title: library_id

attributes.description: The unique ID used to track libraries from one of the following public data repositories: EGAX*, GSM*, SRX*, ERX*, DRX, HRX, CRX
attributes.name: library_id_repository
attributes.rationale: Links a dataset back to the source from which it was ingested, optional only if this is the same as the library_id.
attributes.title: library_id_repository

attributes.description: Indicating which samples' libraries were prepared in the same chip/plate/etc., e.g. batch1, batch2.
attributes.name: library_preparation_batch
attributes.rationale: Sample preparation is a major source of batch effects.
attributes.title: library_preparation_batch

attributes.description: The identifier (or accession number) that indicates which samples' libraries were sequenced in the same run.
attributes.name: library_sequencing_run
attributes.rationale: Library sequencing is a major source of batch effects
attributes.title: library_sequencing_run

attributes.description: The pseudonymised name of the site where the sample was collected.
attributes.name: sample_collection_site
attributes.rationale: To understand whether the collection site contributes to batch effects
attributes.title: sample_collection_site
attributes.values: It is strongly recommended that this identifier be designed so that it is unique to a given site within the collection of datasets that includes this site (for example, the labels 'site1', 'site2' may appear in other datasets thus rendering them indistinguishable).

attributes.description: Time point when the sample was collected. This field is only needed if multiple samples from the same subject are available and collected at different time points. Sample collection dates (e.g. 23/09/22) cannot be used due to patient data protection, only relative time points should be used here (e.g. day3).
attributes.name: sample_collection_relative_time_point
attributes.rationale: Explains variability in the data between samples from the same subject
attributes.title: sample_collection_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Estimated number of cells loaded for library construction.
attributes.name: cell_number_loaded
attributes.rationale: Can explain the number of doublets found in samples
attributes.title: cell_number_loaded

attributes.description: If measured, per sample cell viability before library preparation (as a percentage).
attributes.name: cell_viability_percentage
attributes.rationale: Is a measure of sample quality that could be used to explain outlier samples
attributes.title: cell_viability_percentage

attributes.description: Institution where the samples were processed.
attributes.name: institute
attributes.rationale: To be able to link to other studies from the same institution as sometimes samples from different labs in the same institute are processed via similar core facilities. Thus batch effects may be smaller for datasets from the same institute even if other factors differ.
attributes.title: institute

attributes.description: Encoding of author knowledge on any further information related to likely batch effects.
attributes.example: Batch run by different personnel on different days
attributes.name: author_batch_notes
attributes.rationale: Space for author intuition of batch effects in their dataset
attributes.title: author_batch_notes

attributes.description: A general description of the protocol. If possible specify in what container the tissue was collected in, and if it was processed prior to storage or dissociation
attributes.example: tissue collected in DMEM/F12 containing 10% FCS and washed in PBS. Frozen within 2h of surgery after all fat trimmed off.
attributes.name: collected_tissue_processing
attributes.title: collected_tissue_processing

attributes.description: Was the sample transported at all? What are the details?
attributes.example: snap frozen tissue shipped from Argentina to the UK on dry ice.
attributes.name: tissue_transportation
attributes.title: tissue_transportation

attributes.description: Transit time in hours between tissue collection and tissue processing, meaning either storage in the laboratory or processing for sequencing.
attributes.name: time_to_laboratory
attributes.title: time_to_laboratory

attributes.description: The side of the donor the sample was collected from.
attributes.name: side_of_tissue_collected
attributes.title: side_of_tissue_collected

attributes.description: The method by which a biomaterial was stored before tissue dissociation or processing
attributes.example: ambient temperature; cut slide; fresh; frozen at -70C; frozen at -80C; frozen at -150C; frozen in liquid nitrogen; frozen in vapor phase; paraffin block; RNAlater at 4C; RNAlater at 25C; RNAlater at -20C
attributes.name: sample_storage_method
attributes.title: sample_storage_method
attributes.values: ambient temperature; cut slide; fresh; frozen at -70C; frozen at -80C; frozen at -150C; frozen in liquid nitrogen; frozen in vapor phase; paraffin block; RNAlater at 4C; RNAlater at 25C; RNAlater at -20C

attributes.description: Indicate the time interval between the sample collection and the sample storage in sample storage relative time units.
attributes.name: sample_storage_relative_time_point
attributes.title: sample_storage_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Indicate the Time units of the time interval between the sample collection and the sample storage.
attributes.name: sample_storage_relative_time_unit
attributes.title: sample_storage_relative_time_unit

attributes.description: Indicate the time interval between the sample collection and the sample dissociation in sample dissociation relative time unit.
attributes.name: sample_dissociation_relative_time_point
attributes.title: sample_dissociation_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Indicate the Time units of the time interval between the sample collection and the sample dissociation.
attributes.name: sample_dissociation_relative_time_unit
attributes.title: sample_dissociation_relative_time_unit

attributes.description: The temperature that the tissue was digested with the digestion solution in Celsius degree or hot/ cold
attributes.name: digestion_temperature
attributes.title: digestion_temperature

attributes.description: A general description for the dissociation protocol of the tissue.
attributes.name: dissociation_description
attributes.title: dissociation_description

attributes.description: The publication or protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
attributes.name: dissociation_doi
attributes.title: dissociation_doi

attributes.description: Length of time the biomaterial was stored prior to library prepration in Storage time units.
attributes.name: cell_suspension_storage_time
attributes.title: cell_suspension_storage_time

attributes.description: A term that may be associated with a time unit-related ontology term.
attributes.name: cell_suspension_storage_time_unit
attributes.title: cell_suspension_storage_time_unit

attributes.description: Indicate the time interval between the sample collection and the library preparation in library preparation relative time unit.
attributes.name: library_prep_relative_time_point
attributes.title: library_prep_relative_time_point

attributes.description: Indicate the Time units of the time interval between the sample collection and the library preparation.
attributes.name: library_prep_relative_time_unit
attributes.title: library_prep_relative_time_unit

attributes.description: Encoding of author intuition of cellular annotation in the dataset.
attributes.name: author_cell_type
attributes.rationale: Encoding of author intuition of cellular annotation in their dataset.
attributes.title: author_cell_type

attributes.description: Cell Ontology (CL) term.
attributes.name: cell_type_ontology_term_id
attributes.rationale: Encoding of cell type to help alignment with other datasets.
attributes.title: cell_type_ontology_term_id
